item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves DLC character Ken debut trailer, screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out this summer.

SNK has released the debut trailer and screenshots for Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves downloadable content character Ken from Street Fighter, who is due out this summer.

Here is his character description, via SNK:

Ken Masters (voiced by David Matranga in English, Yuuji Kishi in Japanese)

A veteran Metro City street fighter who sets his sights on South Town, seeking closure for an incident to which he was wrongfully tied. Burning with determination and a fiery arsenal of unmatched offense, this former US National Fighting Champion eventually crosses paths with the Legendary Wolf himself—and with that, the wheels of fate are set in motion.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

DLC Character Ken Trailer

Japanese

  • ❯

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Definitive Edition launches August 14
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Anniversary Edition owners to receive a 30 percent discount.

Real-time strategy game remaster Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Definitive Edition will launch for PC via Steam and GOG on August 14 for $29.99, developer Relic Entertainment announced.

Users who already own Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Anniversary Edition will receive a 30 percent discount on Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Definitive Edition. This upgrade offer will be available on both Steam and GOG, and will remain active for the foreseeable future.

Here is an overview of the game, via Relic Entertainment:

This is the iconic Dawn of War as players remember it, but optimized for modern hardware. The award winning and genre-defining classic real-time strategy game has been updated for today’s PC audience while remaining faithful to the grimdark original. “Cleanse, purge, kill!”

The Definitive Edition includes all the Dawn of War and standalone expansion content; four classic Dawn of War Campaigns, nine Armies, and over 200 Maps all in one game. The game will feature 4K support, upscaled textures (four times the originals), and image-based lighting for a higher level of fidelity while retaining the classic experience. World lighting, unit reflections, and shadows have all been improved, and new unit gloss and emissive lighting will faithfully enhance the moment-to-moment action. An improved gameplay camera will show the battlefield like never before and the HUD and screen layout have been optimized for widescreen viewing. It has also been upgraded to a 64-bit platform to support the ongoing efforts of the modding community and will be compatible with over 20-years of lovingly crafted community mods.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/warhammer-40000-dawn-of-war-definitive-edition-launches-august-14

item.title: Mafia: The Old Country ‘Gameplay Extended Look’
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Nine minutes of new footage.

Publisher 2K and developer Hangar 13 have released a nine-minute Mafia: The Old Country gameplay video featuring footage from the “Villa” section in Chapter 5 of the story.

Mafia: The Old Country is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam.

Watch the footage below.
